Notes: First tax bracket - lowest rate for income up to NZ$15,600
Source: IRD (Inland Revenue Department) - 2025-2026 tax rates (effective 1 April 2025)

Notes: Second bracket - applies to income between NZ$15,601 and NZ$53,500
Source: IRD (Inland Revenue Department) - 2025-2026 tax rates (effective 1 April 2025)

Notes: Third bracket - applies to income between NZ$53,501 and NZ$78,100
Source: IRD (Inland Revenue Department) - 2025-2026 tax rates (effective 1 April 2025)

Notes: Fourth bracket - applies to income between NZ$78,101 and NZ$180,000. Most doctors fall in this bracket.
Source: IRD (Inland Revenue Department) - 2025-2026 tax rates (effective 1 April 2025)

Notes: Top bracket - applies to income over NZ$180,000. Applicable to senior consultants and specialists.
Accident Compensation Corporation levy for workplace injury insurance. Rate applies to maximum liable earnings of NZ$152,790. Medical professionals typically at standard rate.

Optional retirement savings scheme - 3% minimum employee contribution (4%, 6%, 8%, 10% also available). Employer contributes matching 3% (not shown in tax deductions). Many doctors opt in for retirement savings.
